alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 6:23PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McIntosh and west central Muskogee Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Lake Eufaula State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Checotah... Oktaha... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Stidham... Lake Eufaula State Park... Hitchita... Pierce... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 252 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
